From these visualizations above, we can see that there is a significantly higher proportion of people who have metal illness compared to the general public. 
Additionally, from the third visualization, the years peopoe who work in tech lived with mental illness are way more than general public.
From there, we can conclude that mental illness has become more and more prominent in recent years for people who work in tech industry than general public 
because of its stressful working environment and highly competitive culture. As INFO students who are mostly likely to work in tech industry after graduation, 
we realize that it is vital to look out if the company we work for support its employees' mental condition.
